RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 1 1M Dirt CR: 84. Claiming Purse 12600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON THREE RACES SINCE MAY 17, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since March 1 7 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BLAME IT ON EDDIE was hung four wide then three wide into the second turn, dropped inside, advanced behind PERCENTAGE through the far turn, shifted outside that one to the four path entering the stretch, was bumped near the furlong marker as that one drifted out, gained a narrow lead soon thereafter, drifted in bumping that one at the sixteenth pole and edged clear late under strong handling. AWESOME D J trailed into the far turn, swung wide and was steadily gaining ground late six wide. OPEN OUT pressed the pace two wide into the far turn, kept on but was outfinished while four wide. PERCENTAGE vied for the lead along the rail for five furlongs, got through to make the lead, set the pace into the stretch, drifted out bumping the winner near the furlong marker, was bumped late by that one causing his rider to check as the winner drifted in in front of him then faded. SAY HEY KID offered a mild bid four wide on the far turn then leveled off. KLAATU broke in front, set a pressured pace off the rail in the three path into the far turn, kept pressure on the leader into the stretch and weakened late. ROSAS WAY failed to menace. ADANO with the second flight two wide, was through after a half. THE STEWARDS POSTED THE INQUIRY SIGN AND THE RIDER OF PERCENTAGE LODGED A CLAIM OF FOUL AGAINST THE RIDER OF THE WINNER FOR INTEFERENCE IN THE STRETCH. AFTER REVIEW THE STEWARDS DISQUALIFIED BLAME IT ON EDDIE AND PLACED HIM FOURTH.

ENTRY.NAME: Say Hey Kid
ENTRY.COMMENT: middle move, 4 wide, leveled off

ENTRY.NAME: Percentage
ENTRY.COMMENT: vied rail, got through 2nd turn, led, bumped, checked 1/16, foul

ENTRY.NAME: Rosas Way
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Open Out
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 2 wide, outfinished 4wide

ENTRY.NAME: Adano
ENTRY.OWNER: R and P Racing Stables, LLC
ENTRY.COMMENT: second flight, 2 wide, through after half,

ENTRY.NAME: Awesome D J
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, swung wide, late gain, 6 wide,

WINNERS_DETAILS.BREEDER: Adena Springs & Mr. & Mrs. Richard S. Kaster

ENTRY.NAME: Klaatu
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, set pressured pace 2nd turn, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: dq-Blame It On Eddie
ENTRY.COMMENT: 4w,1st turn, dropped inside 2nd turn, split foes4p, bumped, drivg

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 79. Claiming Purse 16000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: APPRAISAL stalked the pace into the stretch, surged late between rivals three wide and got up in the final strides. GOLD HERITAGE allowed to settle, rallied steadily late four wide and just missed getting up in time. AWESOME ENOUGH pressed the pace along the rail to the top of the stretch, made the lead, drifted out late under right handed urging bumping with MASTER and was outfinished. MASTER broke alertly, set a pressured pace two wide to the top of the stretch, drifted out late, was bumped causing his rider to check nearing the wire and was also. GRAND DEAL closed a gap late outside. EL SICARIO bobbled at the start, settled within striking range, lacked the needed responded and finished on even terms with GRAND DEAL at the wire.

ENTRY.NAME: Awesome Enough
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed rail, led, drifted out, right urging, bumped late

ENTRY.NAME: dh-Grand Deal
ENTRY.COMMENT: closed gap late outside

ENTRY.NAME: Gold Heritage
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, closed 4 wide, just missed,

ENTRY.NAME: dh-El Sicario
ENTRY.COMMENT: bobbled start, close up, no rally

ENTRY.NAME: Master
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace, 2w, drifted, bmpd,checked between horses late

ENTRY.NAME: Appraisal
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, surged between horses, 3 wide, up in final strides,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 3 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 13500. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 17 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRACTICAL MAN prompted the pace three wide into the turn, made the lead before the quarter pole, set the balance of the pace, drifted out to the middle of the racetrack under left handed urging and won going away. MY TWO AUNT JOANS allowed to settle, rallied determinedly in the three path through the stretch and finished clear for second. THE EQUINEST battled for the lead along the inside through the turn and faded late. UNCAPTURED LYON well placed, failed to respond. DRINKSONTHEBEACH was no factor. FARMHAND dueled for the lead three wide through the turn then weakened.

ENTRY.NAME: The Equinest
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled inside, faded late

ENTRY.NAME: Drinksonthebeach
ENTRY.COMMENT: no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Farmhand
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled 3 wide mid turn, weakened,

ENTRY.NAME: Practical Man
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 3 wide, took over turn, drifted, going away

ENTRY.NAME: Uncaptured Lyon
ENTRY.COMMENT: well placed, failed to respond,

ENTRY.NAME: My Two Aunt Joans
ENTRY.COMMENT: allowed to settle, late rally 3path, clear second

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 4 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 71. Claiming Purse 11800. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 17, 2022. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PEANUTS PERFECTION pressed the pace two wide into the stretch, made the lead then widened the balance of the trip under right handed urging to win as much the best. RULING EMPIRE unhurried early, dropped back on the turn then closed rapidly in the four path through the stretch and got up for second. ADHHAR stalked the pace from the start and finished determinedly in the five path. LORD OF LEGENDS away alertly, set a pressured pace along the rail to the top of the stretch and faded late. DERBYS MONEYMAKER failed to menace.

ENTRY.NAME: Lord of Legends
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, set pressured pace rail, faded late

ENTRY.NAME: Peanuts Perfection
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 2 wide, full of run, right handed urging, much best

ENTRY.NAME: Ruling Empire
ENTRY.COMMENT: unhurried, mild rally 4path, up place

ENTRY.NAME: Adhhar
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, finished determinedly 5path

ENTRY.NAME: Derbys Moneymaker
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 5 6F Dirt CR: 74. Allowance Purse 40100. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, OPTIONAL, OR STARTER OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since April 17 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since March 17 Allowed 4 lbs. (Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WORTHERWEIGHTNGOLD prompted the early pace along the rail, dropped back on the turn, shifted out, came on again three wide under right handed urging and got up in the final strides. MISSION GIRL broke in front, set the early pace two wide then along the inside, dug in when headed on the turn, battled gamely along the rail the balance of the trip and just missed. ANGEL WINGS stalked the early pace three wide, surged two wide into the turn making the lead, dueled the balance of the trip and was outfinished between horses in a game effort. MOBIL CHIC went evenly. NICEASAKITTENSEYES failed to menace. OUT FOR FUN had brief speed. BOSSY LADY trailed.

ENTRY.NAME: Niceasakittenseyes
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Wortherweightngold
ENTRY.OWNER: Fairwinds Farm and Shafer, Steve D.
ENTRY.COMMENT: inside speed, dropped back turn, came again, 3 wide, up in time

ENTRY.NAME: Out for Fun
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed,

ENTRY.NAME: Bossy Lady
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed,

ENTRY.NAME: Mobil Chic
ENTRY.COMMENT: evenly,

ENTRY.NAME: Mission Girl
ENTRY.COMMENT: broke sharply, early lead inside, long drive, gamely, just missed

ENTRY.NAME: Angel Wings
ENTRY.COMMENT: speed 3 wide, assumed command turn, long drive, outfinished

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 6 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 63. Claiming Purse 17000. FOR REGISTERED OHIO FOALS FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE MAY 17. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CONGRATS JENSEN chased the pace from the four path into the stretch, rallied determinedly under right handed urging and was along in time. REBEL POWER delayed the start while refusing to load, broke sharply, quickly opened a daylight lead, set all the pace, drifted to the five path entering the stretch and couldn't handle the winner. VICTOR STORY trailed into the stretch then had a mild late rally along the inside. RONNI'S DAY with the second flight three wide, failed to respond. J J'S FANCY failed to menace. PSYCHOANALYST had brief speed.

ENTRY.NAME: Congrats Jensen
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased 4parh, rallied, right handed urging, in time

ENTRY.NAME: Psychoanalyst
ENTRY.COMMENT: brief speed,

ENTRY.NAME: Ronni's Day
ENTRY.COMMENT: second flight, 3 wide, failed to respond,

ENTRY.NAME: J J's Fancy
ENTRY.COMMENT: failed to menace,

ENTRY.NAME: Victor Story
ENTRY.COMMENT: trailed, mild rally late inside

ENTRY.NAME: Rebel Power
ENTRY.COMMENT: wouldn't load gate, sprinted clear, set pace, second best,

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 7 6F Dirt CR: 86. Claiming Purse 16600. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON A RACE SINCE NOVEMBER 17 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500 (Claiming Races For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility) (Ohio Regis tered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: LATIN SPICE sprinted up the inside to gain a narrow lead before a quarter, set a pressured pace into the stretch and drew off under right handed urging. MORE THAN GOOD stalked the pace into the stretch, had a mild late rally four wide and got up for second. FAHRENHEIT never far back, swung wide and closed some ground late five wide. LAST DROP OF WINE pressed the pace three wide and was outfinished in an even effort. STAY THIRSTY AMIGO found his best stride late inside. MON CAMO pressured the winner two wide into the stretch and weakened late. O CIGANO had brief speed. ICONIC was outrun.

ENTRY.COMMENT: rushed to lead, set pressured pace, drew clear, right urging

ENTRY.NAME: Iconic
ENTRY.COMMENT: outrun,

ENTRY.COMMENT: best stride late inside,

ENTRY.NAME: Mon Camo
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 2 wide, weakened late

ENTRY.NAME: Last Drop of Wine
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 3 wide, outfinished

ENTRY.NAME: Fahrenheit
ENTRY.COMMENT: never far back, swung wide, late gain, 5 wide,

ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked pace, mild rally 4 wide, up place

RACE.RACE_TEXT: THISTLEDOWN RACE 8 1M Dirt CR: 80. Allowance Purse 28000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 123 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since April 17 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since March 17 Allowed 4 lbs. (Claiming Races For $12,500 Or Less N ot Considered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: CARILLO pressed the pace three wide into the far turn, made the lead then widened the balance of the trip to win as much the best under a brisk hand ride. TONKAWA SPRINGS away alertly, battled for the lead along the inside to the top of the stretch then was no match for the winner. TIMESATAPPIN void of early speed, found his best stride late inside rivals. LAST COOKIE bumped at the start, contested the lead two wide into the stretch then weakened. BOURBON TALKING bumped at the start, was in tight along the rail causing his rider to check entering the first turn, checked again midway on that turn, was a forward factor for six furlongs then gave way.

ENTRY.NAME: Bourbon Talking
ENTRY.OWNER: Quarter Pole Investments LLC and Fletcher Kevin
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, in tight, checked rail 7/8, 11/16pole, no rally,

ENTRY.NAME: Last Cookie
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped start, pressed 2w, dueled, weakened lane

ENTRY.NAME: Tonkawa Springs
ENTRY.COMMENT: away alertly, dueled inside, no match for winner,

ENTRY.NAME: Timesatappin
ENTRY.COMMENT: void early speed, best stride late,

ENTRY.NAME: Carillo
ENTRY.COMMENT: pressed pace, 3 wide, assumed command 2nd turn, much best
